timeline.bodyText: you can make the mapper static - also reuse the same one with emptyResult
timeline.author: atoulme

timeline.bodyText: My understanding from working with @shemnon on JSON serialized code is that the team likes to have the right getters, but also to add @JsonProperty with the field names so it's obvious the method is used for JSON serialization.
timeline.author: atoulme

replies.bodyText: That is more of an emergent pattern than a deliberate one.  At one point getters and setters were prohibited from the codebase (pre public release).  That was changed but the JsonProperty annotations were not removed.
replies.author: shemnon

replies.bodyText: it seem that no modification is necessary ?
replies.author: matkt

replies.bodyText: I'm OK with no modification.  There is no written style guide for this.
replies.author: shemnon

timeline.author: atoulme
atoulme

replies.bodyText: This is a magic number, along with 32, and yikes it's everywhere.  We need to factor it out but that is out of scope for this PR, I opened #452 and added a good first issue tag.
replies.author: shemnon

replies.bodyText: I just made a modification that uses the BlockProcessor and I added tests to verify that the RewardTracegenerator is using the processor to calculate the rewards
replies.author: matkt

timeline.bodyText: Same, is 32 a magic number? Should that logic be tested elsewhere? It may be impacted by the chain spec (ETH vs ETC have different block rewards)
timeline.author: atoulme

replies.bodyText: The same I just made a modification that uses the blockProcessor and I added tests to verify that the RewardTracegenerator is using the processor to calculate the rewards
replies.author: matkt

timeline.bodyText: I was hoping this ommer and block reward refactoring was going to happen in another follow on PR, but I'll allow it.
timeline.author: shemnon
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -80,4 +81,31 @@ Result processBlock(
       BlockHeader blockHeader,
       List<Transaction> transactions,
       List<BlockHeader> ommers);
+
+  /**
+   * Get ommer reward in ${@link Wei}
+   *
+   * @param blockReward reward of the block
+   * @param blockNumber number of the block
+   * @param ommerBlockNumber number of the block ommer
+   * @return ommer reward
+   */
+  default Wei getOmmerReward(

timeline.bodyText: I've had a lot of luck changing the order of the fields to match the desired output ordering.
timeline.author: shemnon
